CTkInterface module

class src.CTkInterface.MainApp[source]

Bases: CTk

Main interface of the program. Providing ways for the user to input information that gets checked for to finally be able to fit a model to data.

Uses a tkinter extension called customtkinter to achieve a modern look.

__init__() → None[source]

Setup of the main interface window seen after starting the program, arranging widgets and setting default values.

are_components_equal() → bool[source]

Checks whether the components assumed by the VPCModel model and given components in the interface are the same.

Will default to True, if the value in the result components field is left on ‘auto’.

Returns:

Whether the given and assumed components match.

Return type:

bool

browse_files() → None[source]

Opens a tkinter.filedialog to let the user select a file containing fitting data. Sets internal variables to the file path and name when a file is successfully selected.

check_inputs_populated() → str[source]

Checks the various fields for missing user input.

Returns:

Message with missing or invalid entried, empty if okay.

Return type:

str

check_inputs_sensible() → str[source]

Checks whether the user input ‘makes sense’, e.g. if there are unfitted constants in the model expression.

Returns:

Message with apparent issues in the user’s input.

Return type:

str

compute_params() → None[source]

Runs ModelFitter.fit() on the model and data and opens a window with the results on top of the current one.

confirm_input() → None[source]

Runs check_inputs_populated() and check_inputs_sensible() and displays any strings returned by those to the user.

If no issues are present, displays the interpreted inputs to the user for human validation, enables the ‘compute’ button and uses the input to set various internal variables.

create_interpretation_string(function: str = '...', var: list[str] = ['...'], consts: list[str] = ['...'], **kwargs: str | None) → str[source]

Creates the interpretation string of the user input to be displayed at the right side of the program.

Parameters:

  • function (str, optional) – Interpreted function, defaults to “…”.

  • var (str, optional) – Interpreted independent variables, defaults to “…”.

  • consts (str, optional) – Interpreted parameters to fit, defaults to “…”.

Returns:

A multi-line f-string containing the entered information.

Return type:

str

create_tooltip_for(widget: Widget, msg: str) → ToolTip[source]

Helper Function to create a ToolTip for and attach it to a tkinter.Widget.

Parameters:

  • widget (Widget) – The tkinter.Widget the ToolTip is binded to.

  • msg (str) – What the ToolTip should say.

Returns:

A new ToolTip instance.

Return type:

ToolTip

display_interpreted_input(msg: str) → None[source]

Shows the interpretation of the user input.

Parameters:

msg (str) – interpretation of the user input

missing_independent_variables() → list[source]

Returns list of all characters or strings that were entered in the independent parameter field that are not present in the model string. If the field was left empty ‘t’ is defaulted to.

Returns:

List of missing symbols.

Return type:

list

remove_compute_tooltip() → None[source]

Removes the tooltip and its bindings from and enables the ‘compute parameters’ button.

reset_state() → None[source]

Resets the program to an initial state without closing and reopening it.

Raises:

AttributeError – if one of the internal attributes that should have been set are not found and therefore couldn’t be reset.

save_results() → int[source]

Saves relevant inputs and outputs of the program in a file.

Returns:

0 if FileHandler.write_file() finished normally, 1 otherwise.

Return type:

int
